item.title: Saxophone signed! Joyous Virat Kohli wins fan's heart in Australia - Watch - The Times of India
item.description:
Virat Kohli Charms Fans in Australia with Signed Saxophone

Publication Date: NEW DELHI

Source: Times of India

Virat Kohli endeared himself to fans once again during his recent interaction in Australia, showcasing his warm personality outside of cricket.

  • Kohli paused to sign a saxophone for a fan as he boarded the team bus.
  • This display of goodwill reflects his popularity and approachability off the field.
  • Despite his kind gesture, Kohli struggled on the cricket field, being dismissed for six runs in the ongoing Test series.
  • India holds a lead in the series after significant contributions from other players.
“Kohli gave the fan a thumbs-up before continuing to the bus.”

His interactions continue to highlight the importance of athlete-fan relationships, even as he faces challenges in his performance.

item.title: "Taken The Pants Of The Aussies": World Cup-Winner's Funny Praise For Rishabh Pant - NDTV Sports
item.description:
"Taken The Pants Of The Aussies": World Cup-Winner's Funny Praise For Rishabh Pant

Published on: January 4, 2025 | Source: NDTV

During the fifth Test against Australia, Rishabh Pant scored a remarkable 61 runs off just 33 balls, leading to humorous praise from former World Cup-winner Krishnamachari Srikkanth.

  • Pant scored the fastest fifty by a visiting batter on Australian soil.
  • He hit six fours and four sixes, showcasing his aggressive batting style.
  • Srikkanth tweeted: "What a knock by Pant! He's just taken the pants off the Aussies!"
  • Pant's rapid fifty came off just 29 balls, outperforming notable historical records.
  • His innings contributed to a partnership with Ravindra Jadeja that helped India surpass 100 runs.
“What a knock by pant! He's just taken the pants of the Aussies! #INDvsAUS” — Kris Srikkanth (@KrisSrikkanth) January 4, 2025

Pant's rapid scoring came at a crucial time as he joined the team batting under pressure, further solidifying his status as one of India’s top batsmen in Test cricket.

item.title: With Jasprit Bumrah watching from on the field and off it, ‘captain’ Virat Kohli calls the shots - The Indian Express
item.description:
Virat Kohli Takes Charge in Jasprit Bumrah's Absence During Match

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Indian Express

In a crucial match, Virat Kohli stepped up significantly after Jasprit Bumrah had to leave the field due to back spasms. His leadership was prominent as he actively engaged in fielding strategies and encouraged his teammates.

  • Kohli's day started with a minor lapse in fielding positions but quickly took charge of the game.
  • In Bumrah's absence, Kohli was very animated and involved, making adjustments and supporting bowlers.
  • He communicated effectively with both bowlers and fielders, helping them settle and perform.
  • His energy was evident as he celebrated milestones with teammates during the match.
  • After batting, Kohli faced disappointment, being dismissed by a delivery reminiscent of his earlier wicket.
“Let them earn it. Let them play some hard-fought cricket for the next few years or whatever it is. Let them earn it,” - Rohit Sharma on captaincy potential within the team.

Kohli's performance, both in the field and with the bat, showcased his experience and leadership, especially when the team faced challenges.

item.title: 'Not His Battle To Fight': Ricky Ponting On Sam Konstas' Heated Exchange With Jasprit Bumrah - News18
item.description:
Ricky Ponting Comments on Sam Konstas' Interjection in Bumrah-Khawaja Clash

Last Updated: January 04, 2025, 21:36 IST

Former Australia skipper Ricky Ponting criticized Sam Konstas for involving himself in a verbal exchange between Jasprit Bumrah and Usman Khawaja during the Sydney Test. Ponting emphasized that it was unnecessary for Konstas to intervene in the matter.

  • Ponting condemned Konstas' actions, stating it was not his place to step in.
  • He hoped for a discussion in the Australian dressing room regarding the incident.
  • Ponting advised against upsetting Bumrah, who has been impactful in the series.
  • He expressed disdain for time-wasting tactics in cricket, suggesting it can backfire.
  • Australia suffered as Bumrah dismissed Khawaja on the last delivery of Day 1.
“I didn’t like Konstas getting involved. That was not his battle to fight.” - Ricky Ponting

The incident highlights the importance of senior players managing their disputes without unnecessary interference from younger players.

item.title: "Cows Could Have...": Sunil Gavaskar Slams SCG Pitch As 15 Wickets Fall On Day 2 Of 5th Test - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Sunil Gavaskar Critiques SCG Pitch as 15 Wickets Fall in Fifth Test

Publication Date: January 25, 2025 Source: NDTV

The ongoing fifth Test at the Sydney Cricket Ground has seen a total of 15 wickets tumble on the second day, prompting legendary cricketer Sunil Gavaskar to voice his concerns about the pitch conditions.

  • After 11 wickets fell on day one, day two resulted in another 15 wickets.
  • India bowled out Australia for 181, taking a four-run first-innings lead.
  • Gavaskar suggests that the pitch conditions would be criticized if they occurred in India.
  • Scott Boland excelled, taking 4 wickets for 42 runs after having taken 4 for 31 on day one.
  • Australia's Alex Carey praised Boland's performance and strategy.
“If 15 wickets fell (on one day) in India, all hell would have broken loose.” - Sunil Gavaskar

In conclusion, this Test match is raising questions about ideal playing conditions and the nature of pitches used in cricket.

item.title: Workload may've affected Jasprit Bumrah but he's not this BGT's top workhorse - The Times of India
item.description:
Workload may've affected Jasprit Bumrah but he's not this BGT's top workhorse

Date: Not specified Source: Times of India

India's ace bowler, Jasprit Bumrah, has garnered attention not just for his performances but also for his workload amid concerns over a potential back spasm. As the Border-Gavaskar Trophy approaches its conclusion, Bumrah's fitness for the crucial matches remains uncertain.

  • Bumrah has taken 31 wickets in just five Tests of the series.
  • Despite his efforts, he is not in the top two for overs bowled this series.
  • Australia's Pat Cummins and Mitchell Starc have bowled more deliveries than Bumrah.
  • In batting contributions, Bumrah has scored 42 runs compared to Cummins' 159 and Starc's 97.
“It remains unclear whether he will take the field tomorrow.”

As discussions swirl around his performance and fitness, the cricketing world anxiously awaits Bumrah's next steps as India strives for victory in the series.

item.title: Virat Kohli's 40-minute nostalgia act amid Bumrah injury scare reprises glory days, shows India what they're missing - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Virat Kohli's 40-minute nostalgia act amid Bumrah injury scare reprises glory days, shows India what they're missing

Publication Date: [Date not provided]   Source: Hindustan Times

The article discusses Virat Kohli's impressive leadership during a crucial moment in a Test match when Jasprit Bumrah was sidelined due to injury. Kohli took charge and rallied the team, showcasing his tactical acumen and ability to inspire.

  • Jasprit Bumrah suffered from back spasms, leading to concerns during a Test match.
  • Bumrah was a key player, having taken 31 wickets before the injury occurred.
  • Kohli stepped up in Bumrah's absence, effectively coordinating the bowling attack.
  • The team showcased resilience and impressive catching during the match.
  • Kohli's leadership was highlighted as he guided his teammates through a challenging moment.
“His bat might have been overcome by ice, but the fire in Kohli is still burning bright.”

In conclusion, Virat Kohli's performance highlighted his capabilities as a leader, reminding fans and players of his strategic brilliance and inspirational presence on the cricket field.

item.title: Pant's blitz and Test cricket on warp-speed at SCG - Cricbuzz
item.description:
Pant's Blitz and Test Cricket on Warp-Speed at SCG

Publication Date: Not provided
Source: Cricbuzz

Rishabh Pant played a remarkable innings against Australia at the SCG, scoring 61 runs off just 33 balls, showcasing a rapid approach to Test cricket on a challenging pitch.

  • Pant's explosive knock highlighted a day of fast-paced Test cricket where over 300 runs were scored.
  • The match saw a total of 15 wickets fall, indicating a day full of action and drama.
  • Virat Kohli faced a disappointing end in his final Test innings on Australian soil.
  • Jasprit Bumrah and Mohammad Siraj were instrumental in bowling early breakthroughs.
Pant was providing a blueprint to every other batter who'd take strike in Sydney for the reminder of the match.

The match showcased the unpredictability of Test cricket, as all outcomes remained possible heading into the climax of the series.

item.title: Watch: Rohit Sharma Silences Retirement Talk, Delivers Mic-Drop Response To Presenter - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Watch: Rohit Sharma Silences Retirement Talk, Delivers Mic-Drop Response To Presenter

Publication Date: January 4, 2025 Source: NDTV Sports

Rohit Sharma's future in Test cricket remains uncertain as he took a self-imposed break from the playing XI. During an interview, he addressed retirement speculations, asserting he is not going anywhere yet.

  • Rohit has opted out of the fifth Test, citing a lack of form.
  • He humorously responded to a presenter’s statement about his captaincy, proclaiming, "I'm not going anywhere yet!".
  • He emphasized the importance of focusing on the present and not predicting the future.
  • Rohit highlighted his long experience in cricket, stating outside opinions won't dictate his decisions.
“At the same time I have to be realistic as well.” - Rohit Sharma

Rohit Sharma indicated he will take time to evaluate his future in Test cricket, with the next series not until June.

item.title: 'Cannot take us for granted': Prasidh Krishna's fiery 'all eleven of us are here' reminder to Sam Konstas - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Prasidh Krishna's Fiery Reminder to Sam Konstas During Sydney Test

January 04, 2025, HT Sports

The Sydney Test between Australia and India is heading for a thrilling conclusion, with both teams vying for victory. Prasidh Krishna issued a strong statement to Sam Konstas, emphasizing the unity and aggression of the entire Indian team.

  • Prasidh Krishna stated, "If you want to fight, you have to face the whole Indian lineup."
  • India took a narrow lead of 4 runs after bundling Australia out for 181.
  • Rishabh Pant scored 61 runs off 33 balls, significantly contributing to India's extended lead.
  • Jasprit Bumrah left the field due to back spasms on Day 2.
“You cannot take us for granted. We are here, all eleven of us.” - Prasidh Krishna

In conclusion, Krishna's remarks reflect the team spirit and determination of the Indian squad, signaling a fierce competition ahead in the match.

item.title: Navjot Singh Sidhu backs Rohit Sharma, slams Indian Team management: ‘Removing him during series sends wrong signals’ - Mint
item.description:
Navjot Singh Sidhu backs Rohit Sharma, slams Indian Team management: ‘Removing him during series sends wrong signals’

Date: January 4, 2025

Source: Press Trust of India

Former Indian cricketer Navjot Singh Sidhu has expressed his support for Indian skipper Rohit Sharma regarding his decision to opt out of the final Test against Australia, stressing that such decisions should not be made during a series.

  • Sidhu criticized the management for sending the wrong signals by removing Sharma during the series.
  • He emphasized that Rohit deserves respect and faith, even amidst a dip in form, due to his past achievements.
  • Rohit, addressing the controversy, stated the decision to sit out was challenging for him but prioritized the team's needs.
“Such decisions have to be taken before or after a series. Horses cannot be changed midstream.” — Navjot Singh Sidhu

Rohit reflected on his commitment to the team and the importance of collective needs over individual desires.

item.title: 'If 15 wickets fell in a day in India...': Gavaskar fires savage 'we are not moaners' verbal volley at AUS, ENG greats - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Sunil Gavaskar fires back at Australia and England greats

Date: Jan 04, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Sunil Gavaskar made critical remarks regarding the reaction of Australian and English cricketers to the performance on a challenging Sydney Test pitch, highlighting a disparity in how similar situations are perceived in India.

  • 15 wickets fell on Day 2 of the fifth Border-Gavaskar Trophy Test.
  • Gavaskar stated that any significant wicket loss in India would lead to widespread criticism of pitch conditions.
  • India's second innings saw Rishabh Pant contributing a quick half-century.
  • Gavaskar emphasized that Indian players do not complain about pitch conditions compared to their foreign counterparts.
  • The Sydney pitch was criticized for lacking ideal conditions for Test cricket.
"You'll never find us complaining. But 15 wickets in a day in India, man, there would be hell."

In conclusion, Gavaskar argues for a more balanced view on pitch conditions and criticizes double standards in cricketing discourse.

item.title: Stats - Bumrah hits new high, Kohli suffers new low - ESPNcricinfo
item.description:
Stats - Bumrah hits new high, Kohli suffers new low

Publication Date: December 27, 2024 | Source: ESPN Cricinfo

This article provides an analysis of recent stats from the Australia vs. India Test series, highlighting Bumrah's achievements and Kohli's struggles.

  • 10: Kohli's single digit scores during the 2024-25 season, joint-most for batting in the top seven.
  • 23.75: Kohli's batting average, the third-lowest for a batter scoring an unbeaten century in a Test series.
  • 29: Balls needed for Pant to score fifty, the second-fastest for India in Test cricket.
  • 60: Runs scored by Pant off the first 30 balls, the second-most in a Test innings.
  • 32: Wickets taken by Bumrah in this series, most for an Indian in an away Test series.
  • 1980: Last instance of both teams bowled out under 200 in their first innings in Sydney.
  • 2: Pace bowlers taking four or more wickets in both innings in a Test match in Sydney since 2001.
  • 39 for 4: Australia's score when Beau Webster came out to bat, a historic challenge.
  • 36.22: Partnership average of Jaiswal and Rahul, the lowest by a pair that also shared a double-century stand.
Statistics show the stark contrast in form between Bumrah and Kohli, especially in high-stakes matches.

The recent performances reflect significant disparities in player contributions and suggest potential challenges for Kohli moving forward in his career.

item.description:
Yuzvendra Chahal and Dhanashree Verma Spark Divorce Rumors

Published on: {publication date here} Source: India.com

Yuzvendra Chahal and Dhanashree Verma sparked divorce rumors after deleting all their pictures together on social media. The couple also unfollowed each other, fueling speculation about their relationship. Sources have confirmed that their separation is likely imminent, though the exact reasons remain unclear.

  • The couple deleted their pictures together on social media.
  • They unfollowed each other on Instagram, adding to the speculation.
  • Sources have suggested that their separation is imminent.
  • Dhanashree changed her Instagram name, dropping 'Chahal'.
  • Yuzvendra initially denied the rumors but their actions suggest otherwise.

“Sources confirmed that divorce rumors are true, stating that the separation is inevitable.”

This situation raises many questions about the impact on their careers and public persona as they remotely navigate their personal lives amidst the ongoing speculation.

item.title: Prasidh Krishna provides major update on Jasprit Bumrah's two-and-half-hour absence at SCG - The Times of India
item.description:
Prasidh Krishna Updates on Jasprit Bumrah's Injury at SCG

Date: Saturday, Source: Times of India

India pacer Prasidh Krishna provided an update about Jasprit Bumrah, who left the field due to a back spasm during the fifth Test at SCG. Bumrah's absence raised concerns but was later alleviated ahead of Australia's innings.

  • Bumrah left the field after bowling just one over.
  • Krishna claimed three wickets and helped bowl Australia out for 181.
  • Medical team is monitoring Bumrah's condition after scans.
  • In Bumrah's absence, Virat Kohli led the team.
"Bumrah had a back spasm. He went for scans, and the medical team is monitoring him. We will know more once the medical team gets back to us." - Prasidh Krishna

The Indian team is hopeful for Bumrah's quick recovery as they look forward to continuing their strong performance in the series.

item.title: JDJ 11 Fame Dhanashree Verma And Yuzvendra Chahal Headed For Divorce - Report - Times Now
item.description:
Dhanashree Verma and Yuzvendra Chahal Facing Divorce - Report

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Times Now

The marriage between cricketer Yuzvendra Chahal and choreographer Dhanashree Verma may be coming to an end as rumors of a split circulate. Insiders report that divorce proceedings are likely unavoidable, although not yet finalized.

  • Insiders confirm rumors of their separation are true.
  • The couple has unfollowed each other on Instagram and deleted photos of their marriage.
  • Fans express shock and sadness, hoping for reconciliation.
  • The couple married in December 2020 and were previously viewed as a perfect couple.
  • Chahal supported Verma on a dance reality show earlier this year.
The divorce is inevitable, and it's only a matter of time before it becomes official.

As public speculation grows, the fate of their relationship remains uncertain, with fans clinging to hope for a possible reconciliation.

item.title: India vs Australia Highlights, 5th Test Day 2: IND crumble again, finish 141/6 at stumps, take 145-run lead - Hindustan Times
item.description:
India vs Australia Highlights, 5th Test Day 2

Date: January 4, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

Ravindra Jadeja and Washington Sundar remained unbeaten at stumps, but India crumbled under pressure, finishing the day at 141/6, leading by 145 runs after Australia was dismissed for 181.

  • Rishabh Pant scored a quickfire half-century off 29 balls before being dismissed by Pat Cummins.
  • India struggled throughout the innings with several key players, including Virat Kohli and Shubman Gill, losing their wickets early.
  • Jasprit Bumrah returned to the ground after concerns over his injury, providing a boost to the team.
  • Scott Boland was a standout performer for Australia, taking crucial wickets, including that of Kohli and Gill.
  • India's bowlers, led by Prasidh Krishna and Mohammed Siraj, performed well, helping dismiss Australia for 181.
“If Australia don't win in Sydney, they will continue to suffer from a drought of a decade-plus without getting their hands on the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.”

The match remains highly competitive as both teams have significant stakes in the outcome, with India's World Test Championship hopes on the line and Australia seeking redemption in the series.

item.title: India vs Australia LIVE Cricket Score, 5th Test Day 2: IND 141/6 vs AUS at Stumps in Sydney - The Indian Express
item.description:
India vs Australia LIVE Cricket Score, 5th Test Day 2: IND 141/6 vs AUS at Stumps in Sydney

Date: January 5, 2025   Source: Indian Express

At the end of Day 2 in the final Test in Sydney, India stands at 141/6, leading Australia by 145 runs. Scott Boland took four wickets to help restrict India, who had seen Rishabh Pant score a quick 61 earlier in the innings.

  • Scott Boland scalped four wickets, bringing India to 141/6 at stumps.
  • India's first innings totaled 185 runs, with Australia replying with 181 runs.
  • Washington Sundar and Ravindra Jadeja are both unbeaten at the day's end.
  • This match is critical in deciding the Border Gavaskar Trophy.
“After winning the first Test in Perth, India has lost the second one in Adelaide. The result of the Sydney Test will decide who will take the Border Gavaskar Trophy.”

The outcome of this match holds significant implications for the series and the fate of players moving forward.

item.title: Rishabh Pant breaks 50-year-old record; Sachin Tendulkar hails it as 'truly remarkable' - The Times of India
item.description:
Rishabh Pant breaks 50-year-old record; Sachin Tendulkar hails it as 'truly remarkable'

Published on: Not specified Source: Times of India

India's Rishabh Pant delivered a stunning performance during the fifth Test of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, scoring a rapid 61 runs off 33 balls, which has drawn praise from cricket legend Sachin Tendulkar.

  • Pant scored 61 runs in just 33 balls at the Sydney Cricket Ground.
  • His 29-ball fifty is the second-fastest for India in Test cricket.
  • He became the fastest visiting batter to reach a Test fifty on Australian soil.
  • Sachin Tendulkar praised Pant's innings as 'truly remarkable' on social media.
  • Pant's innings featured six fours and four sixes, showcasing his explosive batting style.
  • Despite Pant's effort, India ended the day at a precarious 141/6 in the match.

On a wicket where the majority of the batters have batted at a SR of 50 or less, @RishabhPant17's knock with a SR of 184 is truly remarkable. He has rattled Australia from ball one. It is always entertaining to watch him bat. What an impactful innings!

Pant's innings proves his capability to significantly impact crucial matches, and he continues to be a key player for India.

item.title: India vs Australia, 5th Test, Day 2 Highlights: Rishabh Pant's Magical Knock Help India Take 145-Run Lead At Stumps vs Australia - NDTV Sports
item.description:
India vs Australia, 5th Test, Day 2 Highlights: Rishabh Pant's Magical Knock Help India Take 145-Run Lead At Stumps vs Australia

Date Published: January 4, 2025

Source: NDTV

India had a remarkable day in the 5th Test against Australia, with Rishabh Pant scoring 61 off just 33 balls, helping India end Day 2 at 141/6, leading by 145 runs after dismissing Australia for 181.

Key Points:

  • Rishabh Pant reached the second-fastest fifty for India in Test cricket off just 29 balls.
  • Mohammed Siraj and Prasidh Krishna each took 3 wickets to dismantle Australia’s innings.
  • India is currently ahead by 145 runs with Ravindra Jadeja and Washington Sundar at the crease.
  • Scott Boland took four crucial wickets for Australia.
"This marks the end of play on Day 2 of the ongoing fifth Test between India and Australia in Sydney."

India looks strong heading into the next day, with a significant lead and a formidable batting line-up yet to fully contribute.
